3084f3e6-ff49-4960-b302-a73fb97a47f3.description: Earners of the phase one badge have completed the in-person hyflex classroom technology training. This training covered the four steps for using the computer, projector, camera, and confidence monitor to teach a hyflex course.
3084f3e6-ff49-4960-b302-a73fb97a47f3.name: Phase One: Hyflex Classroom Technology Training

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Attended phase one in-person hyflex classroom technology training.

06675d4b-3357-4c1e-adb8-546b76dd8f15.description: Earners of this badge have completed phase two of hyflex training. This training provided an overview of the hyflex format, best teaching practices, and concrete examples of what has worked in a hyflex classroom. Individuals who have completed this training are prepared to incorporate teaching techniques that create an inclusive and accessible classroom.
06675d4b-3357-4c1e-adb8-546b76dd8f15.name: Phase Two: Hyflex Pedagogy Best Practices

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge attended phase two hyflex pedagogy training.

8e83a924-67bc-4b48-9fb3-c550b81ab947.description: The earners of the hyflex certified badge have completed phases one and two of hyflex training. These individuals understand the hyflex classroom technology. These individuals have attended a training on hyflex teaching strategies in community college classrooms with an emphasis on inclusion and accessibility. This individual is fully certified to teach hyflex courses at PPCC.
8e83a924-67bc-4b48-9fb3-c550b81ab947.name: Hyflex Certified

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has completed phases one and two of hyflex training.

skills.name: Creating An Inclusive And Accessible Hyflex Classroom

72bdfcfd-1c47-4a87-a93b-849da4100133.description: Earners of this badge will have completed a 5-week series of mindfulness training to raise awareness around strategies to relieve stress and empower thriving. Earners will have gained basic fundamentals of mindfulness and meditative breathing, as well as how to apply these tools to: increase awareness of reactivity to thoughts and emotions; practice responding to situations and people with wise action; develop stronger compassion to self and others; and create a more resilient sense of being.
72bdfcfd-1c47-4a87-a93b-849da4100133.name: Building Mindful Resilience

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in and complete the course: Introduction to Mindfulness: Dispelling Myths and Establishing the Breath as your Anchor
Actively participate in and complete the course: Mindfulness of the Body
Actively participate in and complete the course: Mindfulness of Emotions and Working with RAIN
Actively participate in and complete the course: Mindfulness of Thoughts
Actively participate in and complete the course: Extending Compassion for Yourself and Others

Identify fundamentals of mindfulness, including an understanding of the neuroscience of mindfulness and the positive impacts on one's mindful meditation breathwork and on personal and professional wellbeing
Describe the importance of being present and the steps to take to connect with and bring awareness to the body
Explain and apply the RAIN (Recognize, Allow, Investigate with Kindness, and Nurture) Method to bring compassion to difficult emotions
Describe how to use mindfulness to more consciously respond to thoughts and emotions, and use techniques for more skillfully working with thoughts and emotions
Define compassion and how to cultivate compassion to self and others to create a sense of connection and belonging
Complete 100+ minutes of professionally guided meditation and breath work, as well as additional self-directed meditation and breath work practices
Successfully apply mindfulness techniques and breathing methods to personal and professional challenges

eea7d7d6-ae31-4ccb-bdfb-4699b2aa166a.description: Earners of this badge have completed the Cultural Excellence: Ideas and Dialogue (CEID) Level 1 Cultural Competence Training. Along with CEID, earners of this badge will have completed two additional “Diversity & Leadership” qualified trainings and/or development opportunities dedicated to fostering an inclusive workplace where diversity and individual differences are valued and leveraged to lead people toward meeting the organization’s mission, vision, and goals.
eea7d7d6-ae31-4ccb-bdfb-4699b2aa166a.name: Diversity & Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Cultural Excellence: Ideas and Dialogue (CEID) Level 1 Cultural Competence Training
Identify three ways in which their individual training in this core competency directly impacts the organization's mission, values, and goals
Explain new knowledge and/or tools gained, and how they will apply them to foster an inclusive workplace where diversity and individual differences are valued and supported
Define their personal impact on the values of the organization: Learning, Mutual Respect, and Diversity
Explain one way in which they demonstrate leadership within their current position at the institution

0be3bfb1-17ba-4470-aa83-e59ad716899b.description: Earners of this badge competed in a rigorous application pool and committed to a year-long investment in their growth as a leader. Earners gained insight into their innate leadership strengths, enhanced their foundational management skills, developed a strong leadership identity, and strategically utilized those skills to improve their confidence. Earners are now equipped to not only be a leader within their current position, but completed strong groundwork for their journey towards advancement.
0be3bfb1-17ba-4470-aa83-e59ad716899b.name: Enhancing Leadership Program

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a 1-year intensive program requiring in-person, experiential team learning; personal reflection and goal development; executive coaching sessions; and small group assignments
Creation and assessment of Personal Leadership Learning Outcomes
Identify and complete a Capstone Project that aligns and contributes to the organization's mission, vision, and goals
Present both the Capstone Project results, as well as personal leadership philosophy at program culmination ceremony attended by all Supervisors, Directors, and Executive Leadership
Complete a minimum of two Experiential Shadowing Opportunities to connect with and learn from leaders who have great impact on the organization.

aa11c724-9d8f-41b6-af15-09d6768a473a.description: Earners of this badge developed core leadership elements to improve and enhance their ability to effectively lead their staff. Earners took a deep dive into their own self-awareness, created personal leadership outcomes to develop throughout their supervisory journey, and began to apply their new tools and understanding outwards to continue to improve relationships and leadership effectiveness with their staff.
aa11c724-9d8f-41b6-af15-09d6768a473a.name: Supervisor Development Program

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of both pre and post-program assessments, high potential leadership coaching sessions, and an intensive institute focused on building core supervisory and leadership competencies as a team of organization-recommended employees
Creation of Leadership Learning Outcomes, based on 360 feedback, to measure and assess throughout the program and beyond to continue to enhance and improve leadership strategies
Craft and present personal leadership philosophy upon graduation to Supervisors, Directors, and Executive Leadership of the Organization
Apply leadership strategies and tools into current supervisory role to improve leadership approach and enhance team dynamics
Build strategic partnerships with a cohort of PPCC Supervisors

skills.name: Cultural And Emotional Awareness Of Self And Others

1e65553d-7932-49f2-be31-6bb511add5bc.description: Earners of this badge will have completed three (3) “Health & Wellness” qualified trainings and/or development opportunities that have been holistically tailored to impart strategies that improve physical, mental, and spiritual well-being; empowering individuals and teams to thrive both inside and outside of work.
1e65553d-7932-49f2-be31-6bb511add5bc.name: Health & Wellness

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Develop wellness methods and routines to deal effectively with stress and pressure, to remain optimistic and persistent in the face of adversity
Strengthen change agility by expanding personal bandwidth for ever-adjusting conditions and identify approaches to discover opportunity in unknown territory containing unexpected obstacles
Improve resiliency awareness through identifying personal needs for recovery and creating strategies to recover quickly from setbacks
Assesses and recognizes own strengths and weaknesses; pursues self-development to improve individual ability to thrive
Identify ways to leverage individual strengths and weaknesses to positively impact thriving of organization, as a whole

skills.name: Managing Stress In Self And Others

18ba5d9c-97d5-47a4-b92c-4b7c4a93e25b.description: Earners of this badge will have completed three (3) “Skills, Education, & Technology” qualified trainings and/or development opportunities intended to equip earners with knowledge of cutting-edge techniques and practical methods of leveraging technical skills to improve job performance and push towards innovative growth for the institution.
18ba5d9c-97d5-47a4-b92c-4b7c4a93e25b.name: Skills, Education, & Technology

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Connect and apply newly gained education and skills to positively impact current position
Describe knowledge gained of developments and emerging technologies, as well as their applications to respective business processes
Discover and map out opportunities for implementing improvements to meet organizational goals and requirements
Utilize data effectively to improve programs, expand knowledge of the goals of program area, and exert willingness to explore creative approaches for using data

016e1368-e0d6-4252-bb84-ee10c2d3e1b2.description: Earners of this badge will have completed three (3) “Effective Communication & Customer Service” qualified trainings and/or development opportunities intended to equip earners with communication tactics and conflict resolution strategies to achieve excellent customer service to all.
016e1368-e0d6-4252-bb84-ee10c2d3e1b2.name: Effective Communication & Customer Service

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Explain the benefits of creative tension and diversity of opinion in order to anticipate and take steps to prevent counter-productive confrontation
Describe how to help manage and resolve conflicts and disagreements in a constructive manner
Develop and apply effective feedback communication tactics in order to provide opportunities for growth and learning through formal and informal methods
Identify proper methods to analyze problems and weigh relevance and accuracy of information in order to generate and evaluate alternative solutions
Demonstrate enhanced interpersonal skills to consider and respond appropriately to the needs and feelings of different people in different situations
Describe the necessary components to clear, concise, organized, and convincing communication in both oral and written formats
Explain how to anticipate and meet the needs of both internal and external customers in order to deliver high-quality service that is committed to continuous improvement
Demonstrate active listening techniques and describe their impact on services provided

cccbfe83-5968-4b47-b2cb-fa1bf3c93528.description: Earners of this badge have gained a basic understanding of how the fundamentals of sustainability can both be applied within and impact their role at the college. Sustainability leaders at the basic level will have articulated goals for maximizing economic, social, and environmental benefits through their position, which sets them apart as a budding leader in sustainability practices.
cccbfe83-5968-4b47-b2cb-fa1bf3c93528.name: Sustainability Leader - Basic

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

alignments.name: The Sustainability Tracking, Assessment, & Rating System (STARS) for the Association for the Advancement of Sustainability in Higher Education
alignments.description: STARS is a transparent, self-reporting framework for colleges and universities to measure their sustainability performance. This badge is specifically aimed at advancing PPCC's efforts in regards to Campus Engagement through Staff Professional Development and Training, which further improves sustainable practices in all campus operations.

badge_template_activities.title: Attend four (4) Sustainability Leader qualified trainings and/or development opportunities intended to introduce PPCC employees, within all roles of the college, to impactful sustainability thinking and practices
Articulate the value of sustainability practices learned within the sessions and describe the impact of implementing those practices at PPCC
Develop three (3) SMART goals for integrating sustainable concepts and/or practices into their current role

skills.name: Act Sustainably And Be A Role Model

9d9d70c6-dba7-486b-8f12-712802040cf9.description: Earners of this badge will have completed three (3) “Team Building & Networking” qualified trainings and/or development opportunities dedicated to creating an environment that encourages cross-campus collaboration and fosters strong working relationships among staff.
9d9d70c6-dba7-486b-8f12-712802040cf9.name: Team Building & Networking

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Directly link the value of team building & networking to the success of the institution
Leverage individual strengths and skills to foster team commitment, spirit, pride, and trust
Facilitate cooperation and motivate team members to accomplish group goals
Develop networks and build alliances; collaborate across boundaries to build strategic relationships and achieve common goals

Explain how internal and external politics can impact productivity and engagement of a team. Identify individual perceptions of that reality and indicate how to maintain professionalism to achieve progress

936b747f-16b7-4f92-bec6-c91ffe34cf13.description: Earners of this badge will have completed a 5-part series of emotional intelligence training centered around building a foundational understanding of the components of emotional intelligence to bring awareness and management of self, build strong relationships, manage stress, communicate more effectively, and demonstrate strategic, empathetic decision-making.
936b747f-16b7-4f92-bec6-c91ffe34cf13.name: Emotional Intelligence

issuer.summary: issued by Pikes Peak Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in and complete 5 total courses in the Emotional Intelligence Series: Introduction to Emotional Intelligence; Emotional Self-Awareness, Self-Advocacy, & Self-Regulation; Using Emotional Intelligence to Build Strong Relationships; Using Emotional Intelligence to Manage Stress; and Emotional Intelligence and Decision-Making.
Identify what Emotional Intelligence is and why it is important in the workplace.
Apply the tools gained in the Emotional Intelligence series to improve self- awareness,  self-management, social awareness, and relationship management.
Enhance Assertiveness through expressing thoughts, emotions, and beliefs in a socially acceptable way.
Challenge Assumptions and Interpretations by utilizing the cycle of Thoughts, Feelings/Emotions, and Actions to shift to a more positive mindset around a situation.
Participate in a group peer coaching session focused on challenging assumptions and interpretations.
Define empathy, explain its importance within your role, and identify personal strengths and challenges around showing empathy.
Explain how to use emotional intelligence to positively impact decision-making.
Apply Emotional Intelligence tools to manage stress.

73c29a2f-3405-4b77-bfd8-420c7748a111.description: Earners of this badge have worked to gain an understanding of the tools, functions, and purpose of Zoom and WebEx in the Remote/Hyflex Launchpad. These individuals are ready to select a web conference option for teaching remote and/or hyflex courses.

badge_template_activities.title: Content: Bigger picture – why would a new course be needed? How to we gauge the need? Looking to provide some basics of what they need to know to start the process 4 different paths: 1) course in PPCC catalog but not being taught 2) course approved by CCCS but not in PPCC catalog 3) course not in CCCS but fits in a program 4) no program, no courses yet Quality Assurance

Understand requirements in terms of uniqueness for new courses

Describe and implement strategies to properly perceive the impact and implications of a decisions in order to make well-informed, effective, and timely decisions, even when data is limited or solutions produce unpleasant consequences
Identify ways to hold both self and others accountable for measurable high-quality, timely, and cost-effective results
Explain accountability methods to determine objectives, set priorities, and comply with established business practices, control systems, rules and regulations

Explain how to formulate objectives and priorities that capitalize on opportunities and manages risks, and how to implement those plans while remaining consistent with the long-term interests of the organization in a global environment

d343edcd-00bb-4628-961f-5d6d49af1e1c.description: Earners of this badge have explored ways to develop an inclusive and accessible learning environment in a remote and/or hyflex classroom. Individuals have read and are ready to apply unit four of the Remote/Hyflex Launchpad. Earners of this badge have examined strategies to begin class each week, create engaging and inclusive lectures, show videos, ensure accessibility, record lectures, and manage a remote/hyflex classroom.

75e19ce3-a5bb-471a-aa8d-dc9bc40fec2c.description: Earners of this badge have begun the first step in preparing to teach in the hyflex (hybrid flexible) course format. These individuals have gained an understanding of what hyflex means, taking attendance in a hyflex classroom, adding the required syllabus statement, designing an inclusive and accessible course, and reviewed the type of equipment used. Additional technology training is required to become fully hyflex certified.

bb5f2995-8df0-4826-9f90-8d34660c9dfb.description: Earners of this badge have spent time in the Remote/Hyflex Launchpad preparing ways to measure attendance before, during, and at the end of a remote/hyflex course. Individuals who earn this badge have explored multiple methods for collecting attendance data while also checking for questions, assessing learning, and capturing data to prepare for the next class. Earners of this badge have also learned ways to create alternative attendance options.
bb5f2995-8df0-4826-9f90-8d34660c9dfb.name: Unit Three: Attendance Options
